page_analysis.text_content:
Fig 8 Entry feature with 2nd floor above

Note: The 2nd floor over a vaulted entry will count as usual. Therefore, the area will count three times toward gross floor area.

Intersection of front facade and underside or bottom of 2nd floor

Top of 2nd floor
Bottom of 2nd floor

Height

Height

Grade

Isometric View                Side Elevation                Porch Floor Plan

Note: If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway the area will be counted as follows:
• In this example, a portion of the entryway is recessed beyond the house facade and roof. It is included in the area that counts.
• The area is measured to the outside material of the entryway feature.
• The area counts TWICE toward gross floor area.

Outline of entryway floor area that counts TWICE if entryway is vaulted

13

visual_elements.description: Isometric view showing a 3D perspective of a building entry feature with a second floor above. Shows intersection of front facade with underside of 2nd floor, height measurements, and grade level. Includes dashed lines indicating measurement points.
Side elevation view showing the vertical profile of the entry feature with height measurements from grade to top and bottom of 2nd floor. Shows the building profile with entry recess.
Porch floor plan view showing the outline of entryway floor area from above, with notation indicating the area that counts twice if entryway is vaulted.

technical_specifications.parameter: Floor area counting multiplier for 2nd floor over vaulted entry
Floor area counting multiplier for vaulted entryway

structural_elements.main_heading: Fig 8 Entry feature with 2nd floor above

additional_notes: Page number 13 appears at bottom right
Two separate note boxes with different background shading provide important calculation rules
Diagrams include dimensional arrows and measurement indicators
Text 'TWICE' appears in bold/emphasized formatting in both note sections
cross_references: References Fig 8 as part of a larger document series
